japanese:
唐揚げ、ほうれん草の胡麻よごし、ナスの煮浸し、
高野豆腐の含め煮、煮物、シチュー、カレー……。
translation:
Deep-fried chicken, spinach with sesame sauce,
simmered eggplant, boiled tofu, stew, curry...

japanese: まあ、こんなものかしらね。
translation: I'd say that's about right.

japanese:
なにやってるの？
こんな時間に大量のご飯作って。
translation:
What are you doing?
Cooking such a large amount of food at this time.

japanese: あら、おかえりなさい三玖。
translation: Oh, welcome back, Miku.

japanese:
風太郎に料理の仕送りをしようと思って。
これからパックするの。
translation:
I'm planning to send some food to Futaro.
I'm about to pack it now.

japanese:
ああ、そういえばフードシーラー買ってたね。
フータローに送るためだったんだ。
translation:
Oh, I remember you bought a food sealer.
Your intended use for it was sending meals to Futaro, right?

japanese:
（風太郎が上京して数ヶ月。
　私も、初めのうちは新しい生活で
　忙しい日々だったけれど）
translation:
(Futaro's been in Tokyo for a few months.
 In the beginning,
 I was also busy with my new life.)

japanese:
（三玖と一緒に進学した専門学校にも慣れて、
　色々と余裕が出てきた）
translation:
(But now, I've grown accustomed to the
 vocational school where Miku and I enrolled,
 and I have more free time at hand.)

japanese:
（こうして、休日を好きなことに
　費やせるくらいには――）
translation:
(That's why I can spend my holidays
 doing things I like%p-2;――%p;)

japanese:
これでよし！
三玖、パック手伝ってくれてありがと。
translation:
That's it!
Thank you for helping me pack, Miku.

japanese:
いいけど。
料理の仕送りなんて、お母さんみたい。
translation:
Sure, but sending him food like this....
I mean you're acting like his mother.

japanese:
別にいいでしょ。
風太郎もまだ自炊に慣れてないでしょうし、
味のお手本にもなるわ。
translation:
That's okay.
Futaro isn't used to cooking yet,
thus he can use its taste as a reference for his own cooking.

japanese:
それに、これを送れば
食事の度に私のことを思い出してもらえるもの。
translation:
And by sending him food like this,
he'll remember me, every time he has a meal.

japanese: ある意味、餌付け？
translation: For me it looks like as if you're taming him, huh?

japanese:
そういう言い方、止めなさいよね。
私は私にできる方法で風太郎を支えてるんだから。
translation:
Stop phrasing it like that, would you?
I'm supporting Futaro in my own way.

japanese: それにしてもすごい量。
translation: But it's really a lot.

japanese:
まあ、自分でもちょっと引いてるけど……
栄養のバランスを考えるとこうなっちゃうのよ。
translation:
Well, even I feel a little overwhelmed...
But that's what you get if you want to balance the nutrients.

japanese:
あ、そうだわ。
食べ合わせのメモも入れておかないと。
風太郎、バランス無視で適当に食べそうだもの。
translation:
Oh, right.
I should include a note on food combinations.
Futaro might eat without thinking about nutrient balance.

japanese: 上から順番に、とか、ありえるね。
translation: It's possible to arrange things in order from the top.

japanese:
味音痴もあるけど、そもそも風太郎って
食そのものにこだわりがないし。
translation:
He may have bad taste and that's why
he doesn't really care about what kind of food he's eating.

japanese:
これで、少しは食事に気を遣う意識を
持ってくれるといいんだけど。
translation: Now, I hope he becomes more aware of his eating habits.

japanese:
なんだか二乃、生き生きしてる。
本当にお母さんだね。
translation:
You seem more lively, Nino.
You're really like a mother.

japanese: （……生き生きしてる、か）
translation: (I'm lively, am I?)

japanese:
（風太郎と離れ離れになって、
　私自身、どうなるかと思ったけど――）
translation:
(I was worried about myself
 when I was separated from Futaro%p-2;――%p;)

japanese:
（寂しさって、こういう心配でも紛れるものなのね。
　これも風太郎を想う気持ちだから）
translation:
(I'll get less lonely if I'm worrying about his eating 
 habits. I'm doing it out of love too.)

japanese:
（いっそ、こっそり東京まで遊びに行って
　直に食べてもらおうかしら）
translation:
(Should I secretly go to Tokyo to see him
 and have him tasting it in front of me?)

japanese:
二乃？
急にニヤニヤしてどうしたの。
translation:
Nino?
Why are you suddenly grinning like that?

japanese: えっ？　そんな顔してる？
translation: Huh? Was I grinning?

japanese:
うん、ものすごーく悪巧みしてそうな顔だった。
フータローも大変だ。
translation:
Yeah, you looked like you were up to something devious.
Poor Futaro.

japanese: な、なんでそうなるのよ。
translation: Wh-why would you think that?

japanese:
だってどうせ、こっそり会いに行っちゃえ、とか
考えてたんでしょ？
translation:
Because, you were probably thinking
about secretly going to see him, right?

japanese: そんなこと……。
translation: I wasn't thinking about that...

japanese: 二乃ってフータローに関しては顔に出やすい。
translation:
Nino, you're always easy to read
when it comes to Futaro.
Ooh...

japanese: でも、いいんじゃないかな。
translation: But, maybe it's okay.

japanese:
きっとフータローも、
こんなに美味しい料理を送られたら
二乃に会いたくなっちゃうだろうし。
translation:
If Futaro receives such delicious food,
he'll definitely want to see you, Nino.

japanese:
そ、そうかしら？
そうよね、きっとそうだわ！
translation:
R-really?
Yeah, that must be it!

japanese: これ、やっぱり餌付けかも。
translation: This is like taming an animal with food.

japanese:
もー！
あんたはいちいち一言多いのよっ！
translation:
Ugh!
You always have to put a twist on things!

japanese:
（久しぶりに会ったら、
　風太郎はどんな反応してくれるかしら？）
translation:
(Finally meeting after a long time of not seeing each 
 other, I wonder how Futaro will react?)

japanese:
（ビックリして、素直に喜んでくれる？
　それとも勝手に来るなって叱るの？）
translation:
(Will he be surprised and happy,
 or scold me for coming without permission?)

japanese:
（叱られても私は止まらないわよ？
　だって――）
translation:
(Even if he scolds me,
 I won't give up. After all%p-2;――%p;)

japanese:
（恋は攻めてこそ輝くものだもの。
　そうでしょ、風太郎！）
translation:
(Love shines when one's on the offensive.
 Right, Futaro?!)
